BMS.description: Permissions for basic BMS operations, such as starting, stopping, restarting a BMS, querying BMS details, and attaching data disks to or detaching data disks from a BMS.
The read-only permissions to all BMS resources, which can be used for statistics and survey.

CBR.description: Common user permissions for CBR. Users granted these permissions can create, view, and delete vaults and backups, but cannot create, update, or delete policies.
Read-only permissions for CBR. Users granted these permissions can only view CBR data.
Administrator permissions for CBR. Users granted these permissions can operate and use all vaults, backups, and policies.

CDM.description: All permissions on Cloud Data Migration
Read-only permission on Cloud Data Migration
All permissions on Cloud Data Migration except elastic IP address binding and unbinding
Operation permissions on Cloud Data Migration jobs and links

CS.description: Cloud Stream Service Tenant Administrator, can manage multiple CS users

CSE.description: The read-only permissions to all CSE resources.

CSS.description: All permissions for Cloud Search Service.
Read-only permissions for viewing Cloud Search Service.

DAS.description: Full permissions for Data Admin Service.

DCS.description: Common permissions of DCS service, except create, modify, delete and scale-up.
Permissions to assign to DCS agencies.
All permissions for Distributed Cache Service
Read-only permissions for Distributed Cache Service.

DDM.description: Common user permissions for DDM, except for permissions of creating, deleting, and scaling out DDM instances, scaling out schemas, rolling back schema scaling tasks, and changing instance class
Read-only permissions for Distributed Database Middleware
Read-only permissions for Distributed Database Middleware
Common user permissions for DDM, except for permissions of creating, deleting, and scaling out DDM instances, scaling out schemas, rolling back schema scaling tasks, and changing instance class
Full permissions for Distributed Database Middleware
Full permissions for Distributed Database Middleware

DDS.description: Read-only permissions for Document Database Service.
Database administrator permissions for all operations except deleting DDS resources.
DBA permissions of Document Database Service, except delete.
Full permissions for Document Database Service.
The read-only permissions to all Document Database Service resources, which can be used for statistics and survey.
All permissions of Document Database Service.

DLI.description: All permissions for Data Lake Insight.
Read-only permissions for Data Lake Insight.
Full permissions for Data Lake Insight.

DMS.description: Common permissions of Distributed Message Service, except install, modify, delete and so on.
The read-only permissions to all Distributed Message Service resources.

DRS.description: Read-only permissions for Data Replication Service.
Full permissions for  Data Replication Service.

DWS.description: The read-only permissions to all DWS resources.

ECS.description: Common permissions of ECS service, except installation, delete, reinstallation and so on.
The read-only permissions to all ECS resources, which can be used for statistics and survey.

ELB.description: The read-only permissions to all ELB resources, which can be used for statistics and survey.

EVS.description: Read-only permissions for Elastic Volume Service.
Full permissions for Elastic Volume Service, including creating, expanding, attaching, detaching, querying, and deleting EVS disks.

FunctionGraph.description: The read-only permissions to all functiongraph resources
The read-only permissions to all functiongraph resources
Common operations for functiongraph service, include query and invoke function

GES.description: Full permissions for Graph Engine Service.
Usage permissions for Graph Engine Service.
Read-only permissions for Graph Engine Service.

IAM.description: Read-only permissions for Identity and Access Management.

IMS.description: The read-only permissions to all IMS resources
All permissions of Image Management Service

MRS.description: Read-only permissions for MapReduceService, including permissions for querying cluster sandread-only permissions for ECS, BMS, EVS, and VPC

Administrator permissions for MapReduce Service, including permissions to perform all operations on clusters, such as creating, scaling out, scaling in, scaling up, deleting, and querying the clusters, as well as all permissions for ECS, BMS, EVS, and VPC

Permissions for using MapReduce Service, including operation permissions on cluster query, tasks, files, tags, patches, operation and maintenance, and alarm configuration as well as read-only permissions for ECS, BMS, EVS, and VPC

ModelArts.description: Common permissions of ModelArts service,except create,update,delete pool.

NoSQL.description: Read-only access for Distributed Multi-Model NoSQL Database Service
All permissions for Distributed Multi-Model NoSQL Database Service

OBS.description: All permissions of  Object Storage Service.
Permissions to view the bucket list, obtain bucket metadata, and query bucket location
Permissions to view the bucket list, obtain bucket metadata, list objects in a bucket, and query bucket location
Basic operation permissions to view the bucket list, obtain bucket metadata, list objects in a bucket, query bucket location, upload objects, download objects, delete objects, and obtain object ACLs

RDS.description: The read-only permissions to all Relational Database Service resources, which can be used for statistics and survey.
Full permissions for Relational Database Service.
DBA permissions of Relational Database Service, except delete.
All permissions of Relational Database Service.
Read-only permissions for Relational Database Service.
Database administrator permissions for all operations except deleting RDS resources.

SFSTurbo.description: The read-only permissions to all Scalable File Service (SFS Turbo) resources.
All permissions of Scalable File Service (SFS Turbo).

VPC.description: The read-only permissions to all VPC resources, which can be used for statistics and survey.

VPCEP.description: VPCEndpoint service enables you to privately connect your VPC to supported services.

WAF.description: The read-only permissions to all Web application firewall resources, which can be used for statistics and survey.
